snippet.textDisplay: I always found this battle theme particularly memorable with its low keys and powerful beat. This really was a solid PS1 RPG, but it seems to be mostly forgotten now. I wonder what the developer Genki is up to now.
snippet.textOriginal: I always found this battle theme particularly memorable with its low keys and powerful beat. This really was a solid PS1 RPG, but it seems to be mostly forgotten now. I wonder what the developer Genki is up to now.

snippet.textDisplay: SupraDarky Hi, just a little nitpick, I think you have spelt the last name of the composer wrong, can you fix that? :)
snippet.textOriginal: SupraDarky Hi, just a little nitpick, I think you have spelt the last name of the composer wrong, can you fix that? :)

snippet.textDisplay: SupraDarky Can't remember how many times me and one of my best friends have played through this game. And every time I create the exact same monster as my leader =D A white Pegasus! (At least the closest you can get to it xD)

snippet.textDisplay: SupraDarky  I replayed the entire demo so many times... What a great theme, that forest was very scary for me back in times because of the music. Thanks for the upload!
snippet.textOriginal: SupraDarky  I replayed the entire demo so many times... What a great theme, that forest was very scary for me back in times because of the music. Thanks for the upload!

snippet.textDisplay: One of the worst things they did for the sequel was remove this theme, they got so much stuff right with the first one that they ended up getting rid of *facepalm* and to think at the time critics panned the first one and gave the second a great review... idiots.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the worst things they did for the sequel was remove this theme, they got so much stuff right with the first one that they ended up getting rid of *facepalm* and to think at the time critics panned the first one and gave the second a great review... idiots.

snippet.textDisplay: That beat is so sick and catchy! Great battle-theme
snippet.textOriginal: That beat is so sick and catchy! Great battle-theme

snippet.textDisplay:
I hated the end game forests. This game is still one of my favourite RPGs. I've never played the second one but from what I've heard it's shit.

Maybe one day I can hunt down and find me a physical copy of jade cocoon again and play it like I used to.

This game is kind of janky on my 3ds. It's playable but the sound lags.
snippet.textOriginal:

Maybe one day I can hunt down and find me a physical copy of jade cocoon again and play it like I used to.

This game is kind of janky on my 3ds. It's playable but the sound lags.

snippet.textDisplay: Battle hard friends to this funky yet cool tune!
snippet.textOriginal: Battle hard friends to this funky yet cool tune!

snippet.textDisplay: Sometimes I feel that I played Playstation Magazine demo of Jade Cocoon about as much as full game. I even used pencil&notebook combo to make a spreadsheet for combining minions in Beetle Forest. Good times.
snippet.textOriginal: Sometimes I feel that I played Playstation Magazine demo of Jade Cocoon about as much as full game. I even used pencil&notebook combo to make a spreadsheet for combining minions in Beetle Forest. Good times.

snippet.textDisplay: This theme is what i remember most about the game :)

snippet.textDisplay: Really glad to see you still uploading man! Used your channel to host a "guess that video game song" contest at a local comic convention and it was awesome! So many people loved it and almost 100 people participated!

snippet.textDisplay: Love this game
snippet.textOriginal: Love this game

snippet.textDisplay:
Wow Supra, really cool to see you upload music from Jade Cocoon! 
My uncle gave it to me when I was a kid saying "It's kinda like Pokemon..." and I loved every bit of it.
Even then I couldn't find anybody who knew it. I actually beat it again for the first time since I was a kid this year.
Also cool to see you uploaded The Blue Cocoon Master. Now we need Syrus Village.
snippet.textOriginal:
Wow Supra, really cool to see you upload music from Jade Cocoon! 
My uncle gave it to me when I was a kid saying "It's kinda like Pokemon..." and I loved every bit of it.
Even then I couldn't find anybody who knew it. I actually beat it again for the first time since I was a kid this year.
Also cool to see you uploaded The Blue Cocoon Master. Now we need Syrus Village.

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm probably the only one in the world who recites segments of "X Gon' Give it to Ya," to this very rhythm.




Sucks to be everyone else!
snippet.textOriginal:
I'm probably the only one in the world who recites segments of "X Gon' Give it to Ya," to this very rhythm.




Sucks to be everyone else!

snippet.textDisplay:
First game was basic but solid, loved the fusion meccanic and you could also fight the monsters yourself instead of relying only on your monsters.
The sequel was kinda "eh" because they changed the battle meccanics ( basically instead of having every monster being capable of attacking normally and to use special skills they were limited to the special skills that always consume mana and only the fire type had attack skills ) sooooo they kind of disappeared after JC2.......
snippet.textOriginal:
First game was basic but solid, loved the fusion meccanic and you could also fight the monsters yourself instead of relying only on your monsters.
The sequel was kinda "eh" because they changed the battle meccanics ( basically instead of having every monster being capable of attacking normally and to use special skills they were limited to the special skills that always consume mana and only the fire type had attack skills ) sooooo they kind of disappeared after JC2.......

snippet.textDisplay: such an underrated game. the art direction was from Hayao Miyazaki

snippet.textDisplay: I liked this game mainly for realism, tribes and evolution mixing. Probably why i consider this my favorite Turn based RPG ever made.. thought it also was the first i played on PS1 as a demo haha : D
snippet.textOriginal: I liked this game mainly for realism, tribes and evolution mixing. Probably why i consider this my favorite Turn based RPG ever made.. thought it also was the first i played on PS1 as a demo haha : D

snippet.textDisplay: maybe i should have said Studio Ghibli but either way same connection
